target_audience.primary_persona: Czech healthcare professionals (doctors, physicians) who need quick, reliable, evidence-based clinical information in Czech language
secondary_personas: Hospital administrators seeking AI tools for medical staff
Clinic chain managers looking for integrated healthcare solutions
Healthcare IT departments evaluating EHR integrations
pain_points: Time-consuming search for evidence-based clinical answers in Czech
Difficulty verifying VZP (health insurance) reimbursements for medications
Lack of AI tools trained on Czech medical data (SÚKL, guidelines)
Need for quick access to drug information, SPC/PIL documents
Manual generation of medical reports (epikrízy) is tedious
General LLMs don't understand Czech healthcare terminology and regulations
goals: Get rapid evidence-based clinical answers with citations (PubMed, SÚKL, Czech guidelines)
Quickly verify medication reimbursements through VZP Navigator
Access comprehensive Czech drug database with semantic search
Stay updated on SÚKL alerts and medication safety notices
Automate medical documentation like discharge summaries
Integrate AI assistant with existing EHR systems
target_audience.usage_context: During clinical practice in hospitals and clinics - quick consultations between patient visits, medication verification during prescribing, documentation at end of shift, research for complex cases

product_vision.one_liner: AI assistant for Czech doctors providing instant, evidence-based clinical answers with citations from PubMed, SÚKL, and Czech medical guidelines
product_vision.problem_statement: Czech healthcare professionals waste valuable time searching for clinical information across multiple sources (PubMed, SÚKL, VZP, guidelines). General AI assistants lack understanding of Czech medical terminology, local drug databases, and health insurance regulations, making them unreliable for clinical decision support.
product_vision.value_proposition: Czech MedAI is the only AI assistant specifically trained on Czech healthcare data - SÚKL drug database, VZP reimbursement data, and Czech clinical guidelines. It provides trusted, cited answers in seconds rather than minutes, in native Czech language, with GDPR-compliant EU hosting.
success_metrics: Response time under 5 seconds for clinical queries
User adoption rate among target physicians
Monthly active users and query volume
Reduction in time spent on clinical information lookup (measured via user surveys)
NPS score from healthcare professional users

existing_features: AI Chat interface with Czech language support
SÚKL Knowledge Base with semantic drug search
API routes for drugs, queries, AI operations
known_gaps: Guidelines RAG - PDF import and vector search (in development)
Complete VZP Navigator with full coverage

differentiators: Native Czech language support with medical terminology
Trained on SÚKL drug database - Czech-specific medications
VZP reimbursement verification (unique to Czech market)
Designed specifically for Czech healthcare regulatory context
Evidence citations from local authoritative sources
competitive_context.market_position: First-mover in Czech healthcare AI assistant market. Positioned as the premium, localized alternative to general-purpose AI tools that lack Czech medical context. Targets the underserved niche of Czech-speaking healthcare professionals who need reliable, citable clinical support.

technical: Requires OpenAI API key for text embeddings (text-embedding-ada-002)
Depends on Anthropic Claude or OpenAI for LLM responses
PostgreSQL with pgvector extension required for vector search
Supabase dependency for auth, database, and real-time features
Initial SÚKL data pipeline setup requires several minutes to run
resources: Appears to be small development team based on git history
Active development phase - features being added incrementally
dependencies: SÚKL data source for Czech drug information
Czech medical guidelines PDFs for RAG
